Make & Share

/modules/module-01/make-and-share/

Childhood Object Activity

For this week’s activity, we’ll reflect on a childhood object that was important for our learning.

Read Seymour Papert’s essay on Gears of My Childhood and write a short description of an object from your childhood that interested and influenced you. For inspiration, here are some childhood-object stories that others have written:Cello, Knots, Stars, Blocks, Steps, Coloring Set, Kites, Pencils. (Most of these stories are from Sherry Turkle’s books Evocative Objects (2007) and Falling for Science (2008). Also, see Sherry Turkle’s Introduction about evocative childhood objects.)
